comments.body: Are we expecting to support fused convolutions under the same API on AMD in the short term and keeping this override as a reminder/placeholder?  Otherwise it might be better just to delete it and let it use the base class' UnimplementedError implementation.
I have no idea what's the plan of AMD. Should I delete them here or you guys will do that?

I see, this was added as part of the initial creation of the ROCm support; I was assuming ROCm support was older and it was added when adding support for fused convolutions.  If AMD devs added this override, it seems reasonable to leave it there.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +322,326 @@      dnn::ProfileResult* output_profile_result) override;

  port::Status DoFusedConvolve(
      Stream* stream, dnn::DataType input_type, dnn::DataType side_input_type,
      dnn::DataType bias_type, dnn::DataType output_type,
